flawed_nl_solution:
The season is broken up into 22/2=<<22/2=11>>11 episode based on cost
The first 11 episodes cost 11*1000=${<<11*1000=11000>>}11000
The next set of episodes cost 1000*1.2=${<<1000*1.2=1200>>}1200 more per episode
So they cost 1000+1200=${<<1000+1200=2200>>}2200 each
So in total they cost 2200*11=${<<2200*11=22400>>}22400
So in total the season cost 22400+11000=${<<22400+11000=33400>>}33400

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 24200.0, not 22400.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
